class.name: BasicToolBarUI
class.comment: Rollover button implementation.
class.javadoc:
A Basic L&F implementation of ToolBarUI. This implementation is a "combined" view/controller.

Georges Saab Jeff Shapiro

As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.
As of Java 2 platform v1.3.

As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.
As of Java 2 platform v1.3.

As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.
As of Java 2 platform v1.3.

As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.
As of Java 2 platform v1.3.

method.name: installListeners
method.comment: Put focus listener on all components in toolbar

method.name: uninstallListeners
method.comment: Remove focus listener from all components in toolbar

class.javadoc:
Creates a rollover border for toolbar components. The rollover border will be installed if rollover borders are enabled.

Override this method to provide an alternate rollover border. 1.4

Creates the non rollover border for toolbar components. This border will be installed as the border for components added to the toolbar if rollover borders are not enabled.

Override this method to provide an alternate rollover border. 1.4
Creates a non rollover border for Toggle buttons in the toolbar.

No longer used, use BasicToolBarUI.createFloatingWindow(JToolBar)
#createFloatingWindow

Creates a window which contains the toolbar after it has been dragged out from its container
a RootPaneContainer object, containing the toolbar.
1.4

class.name: ToolBarDialog
class.comment: Override createRootPane() to automatically resize
the frame when contents change

class.javadoc:
Returns a flag to determine whether rollover button borders are enabled.
true if rollover borders are enabled; false otherwise
#setRolloverBorders
1.4

Sets the flag for enabling rollover borders on the toolbar and it will also install the apropriate border depending on the state of the flag.
rollover if true, rollover borders are installed. Otherwise non-rollover borders are installed
#isRolloverBorders
1.4

Installs rollover borders on all the child components of the JComponent.

This is a convenience method to call setBorderToRollover for each child component. c container which holds the child components (usally a JToolBar) #setBorderToRollover 1.4

Installs non-rollover borders on all the child components of the JComponent. A non-rollover border is the border that is installed on the child component while it is in the toolbar.

This is a convenience method to call setBorderToNonRollover for each child component. c container which holds the child components (usally a JToolBar) #setBorderToNonRollover 1.4

method.name: installNonRolloverBorders
method.comment: Put non-rollover borders on buttons. These borders reduce the margin.

class.javadoc:
Installs normal borders on all the child components of the JComponent. A normal border is the original border that was installed on the child component before it was added to the toolbar.

This is a convenience method to call setBorderNormal for each child component. c container which holds the child components (usally a JToolBar) #setBorderToNonRollover 1.4

method.name: installNormalBorders
method.comment: Put back the normal borders on buttons

class.javadoc:
Sets the border of the component to have a rollover border which was created by the {@link #createRolloverBorder} method.
c component which will have a rollover border installed
#createRolloverBorder
1.4

method.name: setBorderToRollover
method.comment: Only set the border if its the default border

class.javadoc:
Returns a rollover border for the button.
b the button to calculate the rollover border for
the rollover border
#setBorderToRollover
1.6

Sets the border of the component to have a non-rollover border which was created by the {@link #createNonRolloverBorder} method.
c component which will have a non-rollover border installed
#createNonRolloverBorder
1.4

method.name: setBorderToNonRollover
method.comment: Only set the border if its the default border

class.javadoc:
Returns a non-rollover border for the button.
b the button to calculate the non-rollover border for
the non-rollover border
#setBorderToNonRollover
1.6

Sets the border of the component to have a normal border. A normal border is the original border that was installed on the child component before it was added to the toolbar.
c component which will have a normal border re-installed
#createNonRolloverBorder
1.4
Gets the color displayed when over a docking area
Sets the color displayed when over a docking area
Gets the color displayed when over a floating area
Sets the color displayed when over a floating area

method.name: getDockingConstraint
method.comment: North (Base distance on height for now!)
East (Base distance on height for now!)
West (Base distance on height for now!)

class.javadoc:
Paints the contents of the window used for dragging.
g Graphics to paint to.
NullPointerException is g is null
1.5

to match the toolbar and flip it's orientation.

class.javadoc: Returns the orientation of the toolbar window when the toolbar is floating. The orientation is either one of JToolBar.HORIZONTAL or JToolBar.VERTICAL. the orientation of the toolbar window 1.6
